TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DownloadProgressChangedEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the event of a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Instances of this class are passed to the <xref:System.Net.DownloadProgressChangedEventHandler>.
## Examples
The following code example demonstrates setting an event handler for the <xref:System.Net.WebClient.DownloadProgressChanged> event.
[!code-cpp[DownloadProgressChanged](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLWebClientAsync/CPP/asyncmethods.cpp#SnippetDownloadProgressChanged)] [!code-csharp[DownloadProgressChanged](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLWebClientAsync/CS/asyncmethods.cs#SnippetDownloadProgressChanged)] [!code-vb[DownloadProgressChanged](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLWebClientAsync/VB/asyncmethods.vb#SnippetDownloadProgressChanged)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of bytes received.
Docs.value: An value that indicates the number of bytes received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To determine what percentage of the transfer has occurred, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example shows an implementation of a handler for the <xref:System.Net.WebClient.DownloadProgressChanged> event. The method displays the value of the `BytesReceived` property.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#42](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLWebClientAsync/CPP/asyncmethods.cpp#42)] [!code-csharp[NCLWebClientAsync#42](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLWebClientAsync/CS/asyncmethods.cs#42)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#42](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLWebClientAsync/VB/asyncmethods.vb#42)]

Attribute.AttributeName: [get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")]

Docs.summary: Gets the total number of bytes in a data download operation.
Docs.value: An value that indicates the number of bytes that will be received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To determine the number of bytes already received, use the <xref:System.Net.DownloadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesReceived%2A> property.
To determine what percentage of the transfer has occurred, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example shows an implementation of a handler for the <xref:System.Net.WebClient.DownloadProgressChanged> event. The method displays the value of the `TotalBytesToReceive` property.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#42](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLWebClientAsync/CPP/asyncmethods.cpp#42)] [!code-csharp[NCLWebClientAsync#42](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLWebClientAsync/CS/asyncmethods.cs#42)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#42](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLWebClientAsync/VB/asyncmethods.vb#42)]
